page.title: 11ASSOCIATIONS FOR LADIES
page.content: { Women's Institute}was set up in 1943, meeting once a month in the Community Centre & making occasional outside visits. Membership 44 today {Mother's Union}meetings are held monthly in the Community Centre, or in Church, with a variety of speakers. There is also a weekday service of Communion once a month & a monthly service for mothers & toddlers.Member_ ship is between 30 & 35. The Sherston branch was founded in 1890. {National Housewives Register}was started in 1983,meeting twice a month in each others homes to discuss a wide variety of topics,preferably unrelated to the home and children. {Meals on Wheels}_ 8 ladies provide home cooked meals for the elderly and infirm twice a week. Each volunteer cooks once a month and delivers them to the recipients' homes.
